citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service (NOS)
citeinfo.title: Marine biogeographic provinces of the Bering, Chukchi, and Beaufort seas

abstract.p: This landmark research paper presents the results of an analysis of 86 fish, invertebrate, bird, and mammal species in 391 50x50-mile cells between Alaska and the former Soviet Union. Principal component analysis was used to identify six provinces, based on species utilization of the cells. These provinces include the: Beringian Shelf Province, Southeast Bering Sea Province, Bering Sea Slope Province, Beringian Inner Shelf Province, Bering Chukchi Beaufort Seas Shelf Province, and North Pacific Province. These assemblages are de facto management units, as they support similar groups of species. The analyses presented significantly advanced our understanding of species utilization of the Bering, Chukchi, and Beaufort seas. Understanding these relationships is vital to developing strategies for managing these resources.
Sherman K., L.M. Alexander, and B.D. Gold (eds.) Large Marine Ecosystems

descript.purpose: A report on the Marine biogeographic provinces of the Bering, Chukchi, and Beaufort seas. In: Sherman K., L.M. Alexander, and B.D. Gold (eds.) Large Marine Ecosystemsï¾…
